      Request groupRequestIdentifier(java.lang.String groupRequestIdentifier)
      Identifier optionally added to the group request that is to be fanned out to each member of the group in order to detect loops and avoid duplicated handling of operation in case of loops of group and common members between groups that have parent-child relationship.

      • resultExpirationTimestamp

        public Request resultExpirationTimestamp(OneM2M.Time resultExpirationTimestamp)
        The timestamp is for result expiration Example usage of the result expiration timestamp: An Originator indicates when result messages (including delay-tolerant) should expire and informs message scheduling/prioritization. It can be used to set the maximum allowed total request/result message sequence round trip deadline
        Parameters:
        resultExpirationTimestamp - (Onem2m timestamp format should be compliant)
        Returns:

      • resultPersistence

        public Request resultPersistence(OneM2M.Time resultPersistence)
        Indicates the duration for which the address containing the responses is to persist. Example usage of response persistence includes requesting sufficient persistence for analytics to process the response content aggregated asynchronously over time. If a result expiration timestamp is specified then the response persistence should last beyond the result expiration time.
        Parameters:
        resultPersistence -
        Returns:

      • resultContent

        public Request resultContent(OneM2M.ResultContent resultContent)
        Indicates what are the expected components of the result of the requested operation. The Originator of a request may not need to get back a result of an operation at all.
        Parameters:
        resultContent - (nothing,attributes, hierarchical address, hierarchical address and attributes, attributes and child resources, attributes and child resource references, child resource references, original resource)
        Returns:

      • deliveryAggregation

        public Request deliveryAggregation(boolean deliveryAggregation)
        Delivery aggregation on/off: Use CRUD operations of resources to express forwarding of one or more original requests to the same target CSE(s). When this parameter is not given in the request, the default behaviour is determined per the provisioned CMDH policy if available. If there is no such CMDH policy, then the default value is âaggregation offâ.
        Parameters:
        deliveryAggregation -
        Returns:

      • addFliterAttribute

        public Request addFliterAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.Object value)
        This is used for resource discovery and general retrieve, update, delete requests. ï¿¼This is an attribute of resource types. Therefore, a real tag name is variable and depends on its usage and the value of the attribute can have wild card *. E.g. creator of container resource type can be used as a filter criteria tag as "creator=Sam" , "creator=Sam*" , "creator=*Sam"
        Parameters:
        name -
        value -
        Returns:
